official-title.#text: To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to provide for an application process for interested parties to apply for an area to be designated as a rural area, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives May 6, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Helping Expand Lending Practices in Rural Communities Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Helping Expand Lending Practices in Rural Communities Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish an application process under which a person who lives or does business in a State may, with respect to an area identified by the person in such State that has not been designated by the
as a rural area for purposes of a Federal consumer financial law (as defined under
), apply for such area to be so designated.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1002 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the

text.#text: This section shall cease to have any force or effect after the end of the 2-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.
